segment.source: This topic describes the recommended architecture for deploying Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) with the Configuration Manager Integration topology.
segment.target: This topic describes the recommended architecture for deploying Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) with the Configuration Manager Integration topology.

segment.source: This topology integrates MBAM with System Center Configuration Manager.
segment.target: This topology integrates MBAM with System Center Configuration Manager.

segment.source: To deploy MBAM with the Stand-alone topology, see High-Level Architecture of MBAM 2.5 with Stand-alone Topology.
segment.target: To deploy MBAM with the Stand-alone topology, see High-Level Architecture of MBAM 2.5 with Stand-alone Topology.

segment.source: Configuration data
segment.target: Configuration data

segment.source: The configuration data installs a configuration baseline, called “BitLocker Protection,” which contains two configuration items:
segment.target: The configuration data installs a configuration baseline, called “BitLocker Protection,” which contains two configuration items:

segment.source: BitLocker Operating System Drive Protection
segment.target: BitLocker Operating System Drive Protection

segment.source: BitLocker Fixed Data Drives Protection
segment.target: BitLocker Fixed Data Drives Protection

segment.source: The configuration baseline is deployed to the MBAM Supported Computers collection, which is also created when MBAM is installed.
segment.target: The configuration baseline is deployed to the MBAM Supported Computers collection, which is also created when MBAM is installed.

segment.source: The two configuration items provide the basis for evaluating the compliance status of the client computers.
segment.target: The two configuration items provide the basis for evaluating the compliance status of the client computers.

segment.source: This information is captured, stored, and evaluated in Configuration Manager.
segment.target: This information is captured, stored, and evaluated in Configuration Manager.

segment.source: The configuration items are based on the compliance requirements for operating system drives and fixed data drives.
segment.target: The configuration items are based on the compliance requirements for operating system drives and fixed data drives.

segment.source: The required details for the deployed computers are collected so that the compliance for those drive types can be evaluated.
segment.target: The required details for the deployed computers are collected so that the compliance for those drive types can be evaluated.

segment.source: By default, the configuration baseline evaluates the compliance status every 12 hours and sends the compliance data to Configuration Manager.
segment.target: By default, the configuration baseline evaluates the compliance status every 12 hours and sends the compliance data to Configuration Manager.

segment.source: MBAM Supported Computers collection
segment.target: MBAM Supported Computers collection

segment.source: MBAM creates a collection that is called MBAM Supported Computers.
segment.target: MBAM creates a collection that is called MBAM Supported Computers.

segment.source: The configuration baseline is targeted to client computers that are in this collection.
segment.target: The configuration baseline is targeted to client computers that are in this collection.

segment.source: This is a dynamic collection.
segment.target: This is a dynamic collection.

segment.source: By default, it runs every 12 hours and evaluates membership, based on three criteria:
segment.target: By default, it runs every 12 hours and evaluates membership, based on three criteria:

segment.source: The computer is a supported version of the Windows operating system.
segment.target: The computer is a supported version of the Windows operating system.

segment.source: The computer is a physical computer.
segment.target: The computer is a physical computer.

segment.source: Virtual machines are not supported.
segment.target: Virtual machines are not supported.

segment.source: The computer has a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) that is available.
segment.target: The computer has a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) that is available.

segment.source: A compatible version of TPM 1.2 or later is required for Windows 7.
segment.target: A compatible version of TPM 1.2 or later is required for Windows 7.

segment.source: Windows 10, Windows 8.1, Windows 8, and Windows To Go do not require a TPM.
segment.target: Windows 10, Windows 8.1, Windows 8, and Windows To Go do not require a TPM.

segment.source: The collection is evaluated against all computers and a subset of compatible computers is created, which provides the basis for compliance evaluation and reporting for the MBAM integration.
segment.target: The collection is evaluated against all computers and a subset of compatible computers is created, which provides the basis for compliance evaluation and reporting for the MBAM integration.
